titleStmt.title: The batchelors feast, or, The difference betwixt, a single life and a double: being the batchelors pleasure, and the married mans trouble, to a pleasant new tune called, With a hie dildo, dill.
titleStmt.author: L. P. (Laurence Price), fl. 1625-1680?

publicationStmt.publisher: for I W. the younger, dwelling at the upper end of the Old Bayly.,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "As I walkt forth of late ..."
Imperfect: part 1 is bound with part 2 of "An excellent new medley" by Martin Parker; part 2 is bound with part 1 of "Friendly counsaile" by Charles Records.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
